text:
- Hello, and welcome to
Community Chats, I'm Aley Hammer.
And today we're joined with Vu Cao,
the Dev Ops lead over at MECCA.
Vu, welcome to the show.

MECCA is well known in
the beauty industry.
But for those who don't know,

can you start off by telling
us a little bit about MECCA?
- Hi, Aley, thanks for having me.
Yes, sure, so MECCA brings global beauty

in three unique store concepts
and store environments.
We have Mecca Cosmetica,
which is a high touch, a high service,

and a curation of the
world's most lux brands.
Then we have Mecca Maxima,
which is the beauty junky's playground

offering the latest products
and trends to explore.

And then, finally, our
newest concept, MECCA,
which brings together the best of both,

Cosmetica and Maxima, into
the one, large format.
This year is also a special year for us
as it marks our 25th anniversary.
- Wow, your 25th anniversary, congrats.
And, Vu, in 2019,

MECCA became one of the
first Australian companies
to deploy Amazon Personalize.
And since deploying this service,

MECCA generates more than 10
million product recommendations
every single week.
So this is phenomenal.

Can you tell us a little
bit more about this?

- Absolutely, before we
deployed Amazon Personalize,

we had a custom-built
recommendations engine

which was quite rudimentary
in the parameters
that it could accept,
but also the outputs it was generating
wasn't quite as personalized,

and relevant, and
accurate as we would like.
We also had a problem
of having different recommendation engines
in different channels,
and each of them were producing
their own outputs and recommendations.
And so now we're working hard

towards having just a
single recommendation engine

that can power all of
our digital channels.
So with Amazon Personalize,

we've now been able to
provide more meaningful

and relevant recommendations
for our customers.
So, for example, we've used Personalize

to completely revamp our
customer emailing journey.

So, for example, let's say you
pop into one of our stores,

Aley, and you purchase
your favorite foundation.
In about two or three months time,
we have this automatic campaign

that knows exactly when
you're ready for a top up
on your favorite products.
And then, as part of this email reminder,
it would also offer recommendations
to similar and new products

that's completely relevant
and personalized to you.
And the best thing is that our customers
are loving these recommendations,
as we've seen in a 65% increase
in the email click-through rates,
but also an uptick in sales as well.

- Wow, a 65% increase in
email click-through rates,

as well as sales, that's
amazing, what a great outcome.
And how do you leverage data and analytics
to improve your customer engagement?
- Yeah, we're lucky at MECCA in the way

that we have access to so
much rich content and data
throughout all of our channels.
The challenge though is,
how can we make sense of it all
and continue to use this data

to continue to add
value for our customers?

And so continuing on
from my previous example
with the emailing journey,
email data such as bounce rates,
click-through rates, conversion rates,
as well as web analytics are all analyzed.
And then, for each customer,
we generate an engagement score.

This data is then fed
into Amazon SageMaker
where we have custom models

that would generate
customer segmentations.

We can then use the
segmentations to run A/B tests,
so that we can understand and learn
what other content that our customers
are loving to engage with.

But also perhaps it's
an opportunity for us
to reformat the content

to make it a little bit
more valuable for them.

- Well, as you say, it's one
thing to have access to data,
but knowing how to make sense of it all
is the real key to success.
And it sounds like you guys
are doing a pretty amazing job at that.

And, Vu, what is the partnership
like between MECCA and AWS?
- Our journey with AWS

began probably just a
little under 10 years ago,

when we started to
explore cloud technologies
and how can we use this technology
to continue to elevate customer experience
through building reliable and scalable
when available services.
We started off with a tiny, little account

running probably like a
handful of EC2 instances.
And now we have a multi-account strategy
using almost 50 different AWS services.

The partnership between MECCA
and AWS has been incredible,

especially within the last
five years in particular,

we experienced exceptional
growth within the business.

And so to have our AWS team
be on that journey with us
providing support and guidance,

and then now they're
really an integrated part
of the team as well, which is fantastic.
And there is definitely weeks out there

where I feel I talk to our AWS
guys more than my own team.

- Well, I can't believe
it's been 10 years already.
You know, from that small account
running just a handful of instances,
to over 50 different services,

it's been a really amazing
journey and partnership.

And, Vu, to round off this
interview I wanted to ask you,
what are your future plans over at MECCA?
- Can we extend this session, Aley?

Because I can go on for
quite a long time with this.
But jokes aside though.
We have so much in the pipeline,
but I would like to highlight a few
of the ones that we're really focusing on.

So to kick things off,
I would like to talk

about our exciting digital
transformation story,

which is ultimately about
creating an integrated

and seamless experience
throughout all of our channels.
It's the human connection that creates

that MECCA magic to our
in-store experience.

And every single time
you come into a store,
it's a very personal experience.
You're sharing something quite private.

And so now how can we
recreate this experience

and this warmth throughout
our digital channels?

Because every transaction,
there's a story to tell.
And then, on the flip side,

our customers are now
interacting and engaging with us
in so many different ways.
And so we want to arm
our retail team members with technology,
so that they could get full visibility
into each and every customer's journey
they've had with MECCA

to provide that truly
personalized experience.
We also want to continue
building upon MECCA's Dev Ops culture
and Cloud Center of Excellence.
So there's one initiative,
which I've dubbed MECCA Techademy,

which is a formal learning
and development program
across our tech stack

and is aimed at both the
business and tech teams.

We want to continue to
invest in our team members

so then they could be the
best version of themselves,
they're armed with knowledge,

and then just go out and create
new and wonderful services
and experiences for our customer.
And then, lastly, sustainability.
Sustainability is such a massive focus
for the entire business,

from the ingredients
sourcing and resourcing,
the manufacturing, the packaging,

distribution, all the
way through to tech now.

For example, we want to ensure
that our code is running
as efficiently as possible
and that our systems and services are only

consuming the resources
that it only needs.
- Vu, thank you so much.
I mean, like you said,
I would love to extend this session
because MECCA is one of my favorite,
well, sorry to say,
but it is my favorite beauty brand.

So I was really stoked to
have you on the show today.

I'd love to have you back
in a few months time.

I'm actually going on mat
leave, taking a year off.

But when I get back, I
really wanna touch base,
hear what you guys are up to.

And I'm so thrilled that
you're taking sustainability
so seriously as well.
So that's something close to my heart.

So thank you so much
for coming on the show.
And if anyone has any questions
about MECCA and their journey,

please pop them in the
comment section below
and we'll get back to you.
Thank you so much.
- Thanks, Aley, it was a pleasure.
